utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m just gonna run to the store and get a few things. I’ll pick you up when you’re done.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay. I like it a little better when you stay, but all right.

utterance.content: Hey, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello. I’m here for my haircut with Mr. D’Onofrio.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, dear, Mr. D’Onofrio’s in the hospital. Why do these things always happen to me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Excuse us for a second. Sheldon, it’s okay, he can do it. He’s a barber.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He’s not a barber, he’s the nephew. He’s an example of the kind of nepotism that runs rampant in the barbering industry. Besides, Mr. D’Onofrio knows exactly how I like my hair done because he has all my haircut records from my barber in Texas.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: When I first moved here I was nervous about finding a new barber, so my mother had all my haircut records sent here to Mr. D’Onofrio.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: There’s no such thing as haircut records.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, there are.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Have you ever seen them?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon

utterance.speaker: Sheldon

utterance.speaker: Barber
utterance.content: So my kid said the funniest thing today.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: When you tell this story later, the word we usually use is quirky.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Can you pass the Parmesan cheese?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sure. What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m trying to get the hair out of my eyes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, you are one day late for your haircut.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you for captioning my nightmare.

utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.content: Hi, sweetie.

utterance.speaker: Howard

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I miss you, too. So tell me all about your first day.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Did you have fun? Because if you had fun, then you are, you are a winner. Now that’s, that-that’s what chess is all about.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, hey. Sorry, Sheldon, I’ll move.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Eh, why? My spot, your spot, what difference does it make?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, what just happened?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know. Between you playing chess like Bobby Fischer and Sheldon being okay with you in his spot, I’m guessing someone went back in time, stepped on a bug, and changed the course of human events.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, sweetie, are you all right?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, I’m not all right. It’s been six days since I was supposed to get a haircut and nothing horrible has happened.

utterance.speaker: Penny

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, explain it to her.

utterance.speaker: Leonard

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I have spent my whole life trying to bring order to the universe by carefully planning every moment of every day. But all my efforts, our dinner schedule, my pyjama rotation, my bowel movement spreadsheet, it’s clear now, I’ve been wasting my time.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Good. I’m taking that disgusting chart off the fridge.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, Sh-Sheldon, sometimes it’s nice not knowing what’s coming. I mean, look at me and Leonard. We went out, we broke up, now we’re trying again. We don’t know what’s gonna happen.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, please, everyone knows what’s going to happen. But I see your point.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I think this could be good for you. Maybe it’s time for you to shake things up a bit.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon

utterance.speaker: Sheldon

utterance.speaker: Leonard

utterance.speaker: Penny

utterance.content: We did overnight survival training in the wilderness. Big fun. Big, big fun. I was gonna freshen up for you but I blacked out a little on the way to the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Uh-huh. Except you don’t have food or water, and they don’t have a sunset Sabbath service like they do at Camp Hess-Kramer.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Do you sleep in tents?

utterance.content: No. I slept in a hole I dug in the ground with my bare hands. And at some point during the night, an armadillo crawled in and spooned me.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Poor baby.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: But I did it. I survived. I wasn’t sure I was going to when the sandstorm hit. I just pulled my turtleneck up over my head and waited for death. But somehow as I sat there, wrapped in a cocoon of my own neck-sweat, I found that primal part of the human spirit that just wants to keep on living, no matter what the cost.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You’re so brave. I’m proud of you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I ate a butterfly. It was so small and beautiful, but I was so hungry.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Are you crying?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, I don’t think it’s possible. I’m severely dehydrated. My pee is like toothpaste.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howie, if you’re not able to do this, come home. It won’t change how I feel about you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
